Summit Views
📅 October 7, 2025 🕐 7:30 AM 📍 Eagle Peak ☀️ 68°F 📖 8 min read

Reached the peak at sunrise this morning. The climb was challenging, but standing above the clouds watching the world wake up made every step worth it. There's something profound about being this high up—it puts everything into perspective. The city problems that felt so heavy yesterday seem impossibly small from up here.

Started the climb at 4:30 AM with headlamps cutting through the darkness. The trail was steep, and my legs were burning by mile two. But then, slowly, the sky started to lighten. First just a hint of blue, then streaks of orange and pink painting the horizon.

When we finally broke through the tree line and saw the summit, that's when it hit me—all the training, the early mornings, the sore muscles—it was all for this moment. The view from the top was absolutely breathtaking. You could see for miles in every direction, mountain peaks stretching out like waves in an ocean of stone.

Adventure Nature 👤 Alex 📍 Eagle Peak
